frontmatter.title: Quickstart Tutorial
frontmatter.description: Simple end-to-end deployment scenario for the KContainer Shipping Container Reference Implementation.

internal.content:
--- title: Quickstart Tutorial description: Simple end-to-end deployment scenario for the KContainer Shipping Container Reference Implementation. tabs: ['Introduction', 'Deploy on IBM OpenLabs', 'Deploy on OpenShift Playgrounds', 'Run the Demo'] --- ## Deploy the reference implementation ### IBM OpenLabs In this section, we are going to see how to deploy the KContainer Shipping Container Reference Implementation on IBM OpenLabs. 1. Go to [IBM OpenLabs](https://developer.ibm.com/openlabs/openshift) in a browser and click on `Launch Lab` button for **Lab 6**. ![OpenLabs1](images/openLabs1.png) 1. Sign in with your IBM Cloud account or register for an IBM Cloud account. ![OpenLabs2](images/openLabs2.png) 1. You will be presented with a dialog asking you whether you have an **Opportunity Id** or not. If you don't have it or don't no, just select **No** and click on **Launch Lab**. 1. You should now see your IBM OpenLabs environment. ![OpenLabs4](images/openLabs4.png) 1. On the left hand side navigation menu, click on the **Quick Links and Common Commnads** section. Now, if you scroll down on the instructions shown on your screen, you should reach the **Commonly Used Command** section of these and in there you should see an `oc login ...` command to get your terminal associated to this IBM OpenLabs Lab 6 logged into the OpenShift cluster that you will be working with for this quickstart tutorial. Click on the `oc login...` command and you should see a `Login successful` message on the terminal. ![OpenLabs8](images/openLabs8.png) 1. In the terminal associated to your lab, download the [kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/tree/master/scripts/kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh) file: ``` curl -o kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/master/scripts/kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh chmod +x kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh ```
![OpenLabs9](images/openLabs9.png) 1. Execute the quickstart deployment script with the following command: ``` ./kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh --skip-login ``` **IMPORTANT:** do not forget the **- -skip-login** flag since we have already logged into the RedHat OpenShift cluster above. 1. Wait for the deployment to be active and ready when you are prompted with `Press any key to continue once an order has been submitted...`. ![OpenLabs10](images/openLabs10.png) 1. Grab the User Interface Microservice url and credentials and open it up in your web browser. ![OpenLabs11](images/openLabs11.png) _(\*) This will be referred to as_ `kc-ui-shipping.cluster.local` _in the step 2 of this quickstart._ 1. You can also check all the resources created by the `kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh` script in the RedHat OpenShift console by clicking on the OpenShift web console quick link presented at the top of the instructions section of the OpenLabs Lab6 website. ![OpenLabs5](images/openLabs5.png) 1. You should now see your OpenShift web console. ![OpenLabs7](images/openLabs7.png) ## Next Steps **[Move on to run the demo!](./run-the-demo/)** _This quickstart guide will be updated as the project evolves and new capability is added. If you have any issues or queries with this quickstart guide, please [raise an issue](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/issues) in the github repo._

frontmatter.description: Simple end-to-end deployment scenario for the KContainer Shipping Container Reference Implementation.

Go to [IBM OpenLabs](https://developer.ibm.com/openlabs/openshift) in a browser and click on `Launch Lab` button for **Lab 6**. ![OpenLabs1](images/openLabs1.png) 1. Sign in with your IBM Cloud account or register for an IBM Cloud account. ![OpenLabs2](images/openLabs2.png) 1. You will be presented with a dialog asking you whether you have an **Opportunity Id** or not. If you don't have it or don't no, just select **No** and click on **Launch Lab**. 1. You should now see your IBM OpenLabs environment. ![OpenLabs4](images/openLabs4.png) 1. On the left hand side navigation menu, click on the **Quick Links and Common Commnads** section. Now, if you scroll down on the instructions shown on your screen, you should reach the **Commonly Used Command** section of these and in there you should see an `oc login ...` command to get your terminal associated to this IBM OpenLabs Lab 6 logged into the OpenShift cluster that you will be working with for this quickstart tutorial. Click on the `oc login...` command and you should see a `Login successful` message on the terminal. ![OpenLabs8](images/openLabs8.png) 1. In the terminal associated to your lab, download the [kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/tree/master/scripts/kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh) file: ``` curl -o kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/master/scripts/kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh chmod +x kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh ```
![OpenLabs9](images/openLabs9.png) 1. Execute the quickstart deployment script with the following command: ``` ./kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh --skip-login ``` **IMPORTANT:** do not forget the **- -skip-login** flag since we have already logged into the RedHat OpenShift cluster above. 1. Wait for the deployment to be active and ready when you are prompted with `Press any key to continue once an order has been submitted...`. ![OpenLabs10](images/openLabs10.png) 1. Grab the User Interface Microservice url and credentials and open it up in your web browser. ![OpenLabs11](images/openLabs11.png) _(\*) This will be referred to as_ `kc-ui-shipping.cluster.local` _in the step 2 of this quickstart._ 1. You can also check all the resources created by the `kcontainer-quickstart-ocp.sh` script in the RedHat OpenShift console by clicking on the OpenShift web console quick link presented at the top of the instructions section of the OpenLabs Lab6 website. ![OpenLabs5](images/openLabs5.png) 1. You should now see your OpenShift web console. ![OpenLabs7](images/openLabs7.png) ## Next Steps **[Move on to run the demo!](./run-the-demo/)** _This quickstart guide will be updated as the project evolves and new capability is added. If you have any issues or queries with this quickstart guide, please [raise an issue](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/refarch-kc/issues) in the github repo._
